intro: Photinia cardotii, commonly known as the redleaf photinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its attractive, glossy red foliage, which becomes more vibrant in autumn. It produces small white flowers in spring, followed by red or orange berries. Photinia cardotii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
